channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dropped kerb damage, 25th February
item.description:
Pavement outside dropped kerb cracked and uneven due to vehicles parked and driving over it and causing trip hazard and damage JW

item.title: It’s outside my address where I park my vehicle, 25th February
item.description:
The car has been there for over 2 weeks now and it’s full of mould and mildew and insects there’s some kids about that keeps going in and they got very unwell because of this vehicle
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Theresas Close, Hackney, London

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookdene Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely overgrown land, flytipping of hazardous waste, graffiti and antisocial behavior, 25th February
item.description:
The land next to Millennium primary school's Nursery provision is extremely overgrown and part of it are climbing our building. There are small broken trees in the school playground. There is hazardous waste such as broken toilets and other flytipped waste. There is graffiti and is attracting anti social behavior with alcohol bottles being left broken or with contents still inside. The entrance is used by 3-5 year olds and needs to be attended to immediately to prevent any incidents.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): John Harrison Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Communal Non-Recycling Bin, 25th February
item.description:
We have had 3 non-recycling bins servicing the 24 flats at Gillies Court for as long as I have lived here (circa 10 years). Since December, one of the 3 bins went missing. I had assumed it was due to be replaced, however we still have only 2 bins. By Thursday (collections are every Monday), the 2 bins are full and this is meaning that residents are having to keep waste in their households until the bins are emptied after the weekend. Please can you issue a replacement 3rd bin?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Stafford Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cafe leaving plastic crates on the road, 25th February
item.description:
This coffee shop (at 11 Beaconsfield Parade) it's been leaving this crates every now and then, just laying on the road. We know this come from the coffee shop because the rest of the crates have been left inside of their backyard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kimmeridge Road, Elmstead, Greater London

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Pothole on A23 before turning into Wyatt Park Road and causing vibration to buildings. Needs urgent fixing, 25th February
item.description:
Seems other people have also reported this pothole with one cyclist falling over. It is getting bigger in size by the day. The road is heavily used and this pothole unattended will get worse. The cracks are so large that our building vibrates with each bus , heavy vehicle going over it - day and night. It needs urgent repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Streatham Hill, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unswept area with accumulation of slippery leaves, 25th February
item.description:
The alleyway between Wilton Terrace and Wilton Road, SE2 hasn't been swept. This has lead to an accumulation of leaves which leaves the area slippery when wet. Please can action be taken.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilton Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet
